# Draft:Tuesday coworking

----
tuesday coworking is a network of coworking spaces and event venues based in Berlin, Germany. Founded in 2016, the company provides flexible workspaces, meeting rooms, and event facilities targeted at freelancers, startups, and remote teams.
History
tuesday coworking was founded in 2016 by John Neilan and Monika Berstis as a private partnership. In 2020, it was incorporated as MoreThanADesk GmbH, with Neilan as the sole owner.
In 2018, the company received the Coworker.com Members’ Choice Coworking Space award. In 2021, its Belziger Straße location was used for the music video "Lea" by musician Lennart Schilgen.
Locations
.]]
The first site opened on Feurigstraße in Schöneberg on 10 May 2016 and closed in 2024. As of November 2025, tuesday coworking operates four locations:
* Belziger Straße 71 (Schöneberg) – since 2018
* Bundesallee 187 (Wilmersdorf) – since 2020
* Pflügerstraße 18 (Neukölln) – since 2022; acquired from Coworking Deluxe
* Düsseldorfer Straße 75 (Wilmersdorf) – since 2024
The Bundesallee venue also hosts events including the Chandelier Sessions music series and public discussions organized by the Green Party’s Charlottenburg-Wilmersdorf chapter. Past speakers have included journalist Gilda Sahebi and legal expert Ulf Buermeyer.
Community and Activities
tuesday coworking has around 300 members, including freelancers, remote workers, and startup teams in sectors such as tech, media, and marketing. Community-building is emphasized through shared meals, workshops, potlucks, and recreational outings.
Notable members have included R. Derek Black, author of The Klansman’s Son: My Journey from White Nationalism to Antiracism, and Israeli singer-songwriter Sivan Shavit.
Gender Pay Gap Campaign
In 2021, tuesday coworking launched a Gender Pay Gap Campaign offering a 19% discount to self-identified female freelancers. The initiative was featured by Deutsche Welle in a report on wage equality. Founder John Neilan stated the goal was to showcase how small businesses can support pay equity.
Chandelier Sessions
The [https://www.instagram.com/chandeliersessionsberlin Chandelier Sessions] is a concert series initiated and run by tuesday coworking at its event space on Bundesallee. Described by The Berliner as a response to rising venue costs and closures, it aims to foster affordable and intimate live music experiences.
Featured artists include M.Rider, Seamus Fogarty, Christian Cohle, and David Kitt.
